did.head: Descriptive Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: Hoover Institution on War, Revolution, and Peace

did.abstract: Logbook transcripts of telegrams sent and received, relating to Polish-Danish relations during the interwar period. A digital copy of this entire collection is available at http://szukajwarchiwach.pl/800/45/0/-/.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Poland. Poselstwo (Denmark) telegrams, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

altformavail.head: Alternative Forms of Material Available
altformavail.p: Digital copy in Poland's National Digital Archive at http://szukajwarchiwach.pl/800/45/0/-/. It was digitized from microfilm by the Polish State Archives.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This collection contains a large portion of the telegrams sent and received by the Polish legation in Denmark during the interwar period. They relate mainly to Polish-Danish relations and serve as a good source for the study of the international tensions that led to the outbreak of World War II.
These documents were formerly part of the Polish Foreign Ministry collection, acquired by the Hoover Archives in 1959, and were accessioned in the early 1990s as a separate collection.
A microfilm copy of these materials has been deposited in the State Archives of Poland in Warsaw.

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the repository's online public access catalog.

scopecontent.p: Logbooks of incoming and outgoing telegrams, arranged chronologically
Logbooks of incoming and outgoing telegrams
